sailpoint.api

Class ManagedAttributer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.api.ManagedAttributer

  • public class ManagedAttributer
extends java.lang.Object
    The ManagedAttributer provides utility methods for searching, reading, and creating ManagedAttribute objects. It is also used by the Identitizer to promote attribute values from links into ManagedAttributes.

      • count

        public static int count(SailPointContext con,
        Application app,
        java.lang.String objectType)
                 throws GeneralException
        Return the number of ManagedAttributes for the given application with the given ObjectType
        Parameters:
        con - SailPointContext to perform query
        app - Application the ManagedAttributes are part of
        objectType - The schemaObjectType of the ManagedAttributes
        Returns:
        the number of ManagedAttributes for the given application of a particular ObjectType
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • count

        public static int count(SailPointContext con,
        Application app,
        java.lang.String name,
        java.lang.String value)
                 throws GeneralException
        Prior to 6.4 this method was deprecated. If the managed attribute is not an account group, this method is completely valid and will return the number of ManagedAttributes that match the arguments. One example of correct use of this method would be passing a directly assignable managed attribute name/value pair.
        Parameters:
        con -
        app -
        name -
        value -
        Returns:
        number of matching attributes
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • count

        public static int count(SailPointContext con,
        Application app,
        java.lang.String name,
        java.lang.String value,
        java.lang.String objectType)
                 throws GeneralException
        Return the number of ManagedAttributes that match the given arguments. Used by Aggregator when promoting groups related to logical apps. This method does not include Permissions in its count. If objectType is nonNull, look for MA with type = objectType, otherwise default to Entitlement
        Parameters:
        con -
        app -
        name -
        value -
        objectType -
        Returns:
        number of matching attributes
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • get

        public static ManagedAttribute get(SailPointContext con,
                   Application app,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String value)
                            throws GeneralException
        NOTE: this will not work for AccountGroup lookups. We are setting name null for accountGroups. Use the ManagedAttributer.get(SailPointContext, String, boolean, String, String, String) method
        Parameters:
        con - the context
        app - application this managed attribute is associated with
        name - name of the managed attribute, i.e. capabilities
        value - value of the managed attribute, i.e. User
        Returns:
        the managed attribute or null if we could not find one
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • isPermissionRequest

        public static boolean isPermissionRequest(ProvisioningPlan.ObjectRequest req)
        Return true if an ObjectRequest is for a MangedAttribute representing a Permission rather than an entitlement or group. This is represented by setting the sysManagedAttribute type attribute.

        The ObjectRequest.type should be "ManagedAttribute" but we don't care.

        Parameters:
        req -
        Returns:
        boolean true if request is permission request

      • getTargetSchema

        public static Schema getTargetSchema(ProvisioningPlan.ObjectRequest req,
                     Application app)
        Locate the Schema of the object targeted by this request. We're expecting this to be extensible where the ObjectRequest.type property can be the name of any Schema in the Application. Prior to release 6.4 we only supported SCHEMA_GROUP, now you may configure whatever schema type you would like.
        Parameters:
        req -
        app -
        Returns:
        Schema target schema

      • getReferenceAttribute

        public static java.lang.String getReferenceAttribute(ProvisioningPlan.ObjectRequest req,
                                     Application app)
                                              throws GeneralException
        Determine the "attribute name" of the ManagedAttribute targeted by this request. For groups and entitlements this will be the name of the attribute from the account schema whose values are being promoted to MAs.

        For Permissions this is a misnomer, there is no reference attribute this will be a target name.

        Parameters:
        req -
        app -
        Returns:
        String reference attribute
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getObjectIdentity

        public static java.lang.String getObjectIdentity(ProvisioningPlan.ObjectRequest req,
                                 Application app,
                                 Schema schema)
        Get the id of the target object, which will be stored in the ManagedAttribute.value property. This is only relevant for requests to create entitlements or groups.

        Usually this will be the nativeIdentity in the request. For requests on MAs representing groups, we also support this being represented as an AttributeReuqest for the naming attribute when we create new groups

        Parameters:
        req -
        app -
        schema -
        Returns:
        String native identity

      • get

        public static ManagedAttribute get(SailPointContext con,
                   ProvisioningPlan.ObjectRequest req,
                   Application app)
                            throws GeneralException
        Locate an existing ManagedAttribute that would be targeted by this request. This is a static public utility because we need it in several places: PlanCompiler and SMListener.

        referenceAttribute is a misnomer if this is a Permission request, in that case it will be the target name.

        Parameters:
        con -
        req -
        app -
        Returns:
        ManagedAttribute targeted managed attribute
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • get

        public static ManagedAttribute get(SailPointContext con,
                   ProvisioningPlan.ObjectRequest req)
                            throws GeneralException
        Get managed attribute for request
        Parameters:
        con -
        req -
        Returns:
        ManagedAttribute
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • get

        public static ManagedAttribute get(SailPointContext con,
                   Application app,
                   java.lang.String groupAttribute,
                   ResourceObject obj)
                            throws GeneralException
        Locate a ManagedAttribute identified by a ResourceObject returned by a Connector. This became complicated in delta-aggregation delete case because the Connector may not have the native group identity (typically a DN), instead it has a uuid. The usual search methods above don't handle uuid.
        Parameters:
        con -
        app -
        groupAttribute -
        obj -
        Returns:
        ManageAttribute attribute returned by connector
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getEntitlementOrObject

        public static ManagedAttribute getEntitlementOrObject(SailPointContext ctx,
                                      Application app,
                                      java.lang.String groupAttribute,
                                      java.lang.String value,
                                      java.lang.String type)
                                               throws GeneralException
        Return the Managedttribute for the given application. This will return a Managed Entitlement or Managed Application Object type with the given app/value. This will use the attribute (application/value/attribute) as the lookup if non-null. Otherwise use (application/type/value) as the key. Type can be either an ApplicationObject type or Entitlement.
        Parameters:
        ctx - SailPointContext used to query
        app - Application of the ManagedAttribute
        groupAttribute - AccountSchema Attribute in which this MA can be assigned
        value - Value of the ManagedAttribute
        type - The type of the Managed Attribute
        Returns:
        ManagedAttribute of given app/value/attribute with type of Entitlement or schemaObjectType
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • bootstrapIfNew

        public ManagedAttribute bootstrapIfNew(ManagedAttribute src)
                                throws GeneralException
        Bootstrap an attribute if one does not already exist. Factored out of findOrCreate so it can be accessible to MissingManagedEntitlementsTask.
        Parameters:
        src -
        Returns:
        ManagedAttribute newly bootstrapped attribute
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getDescription

        public static java.lang.String getDescription(ManagedAttribute att)
        Format a description of the attribute for use in log messages.

      • checkValidity

        public static java.lang.String checkValidity(ManagedAttribute att)
        Check to see if the ManagedAttribute is fleshed out enough to have a valid hash.

        Used within ManagedAttributer to ensure we don't save an invalid object. Used by the ManagedAttributeHashUpgrader to detect invalid objects and remove them.

      • getHash

        public static java.lang.String getHash(ManagedAttribute attr)
                                throws GeneralException
        Calculate the unique hash for an attribute. The MA must be valid. See file header comments for situations where attribute and value may be null.

        value can be null for type=Permission attribute can be null for nested schemas, don't include attribute name in the hash.

        Throws:
        GeneralException
